text: it was basically hijacking his phone
[Music]
many of the most popular branded
websites out there including your bank
and your your brokerage account lets you
enable two-factor authentication what
that means is you not only need your
username and password to log into the
site but the site will text you a six
digit code and you have to put in the
code to complete the login process and
that confirms that you actually have
that mobile phone so something you know
your password and something you have
which is your cell phone and there's no
way to hack into a SIM card it has
crypto keys and unless you have a
certain key called the ki you can't
really do anything with it
it's easier to trick the phone company
into switching the SIM cards to the one
that the attacker has in his or her
possession
you have to use social engineering and
what social engineering is is using
manipulation deception and influence to
trick a target into doing something or
complying with a request in the case of
Derain the kissin who is a black rights
activist what these hackers did is they
called Verizon pretending to be during
the Kissin and basically said that he
had a problem with his phone yet if they
have yet to put in a new SIM card so
they verified his identity then they
activated the new SIM so now when the
text message came in for the 2-step
authentication it went to the bad guy's
phone so they got the code and were able
to access his account
another way of bypassing two-factor
authentication is phishing so they'll
basically send you a message pretending
to be from you know Google or Microsoft
or whoever you're doing the two-factor
authentication through and you know try
to trick you into texting the code back
at that time and then the attacker will
go ahead and use that code to log into
your account as long as you text that
code within 60 seconds because it
changes every 60 seconds so that's the
kind of a amateurish type of attack but
it works
[Music]
